SEARCH
Package sprouts

Interface Maybe<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the thing that this Maybe is a wrapper and representative of.
All Known Subinterfaces:
Val<T>, Var<T>, Viewable<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Result
public interface Maybe<T>
The Maybe interface represents a thing of a specific type() which may or may not exist, and it serves as a null safe blue-print for nomadic types like the Result type.

Its API is very similar to the Optional type, with the difference that a Maybe implementation is always aware of the type() of the thing that it is a wrapper for.
Note that contrary to the popular known Optional type, a Maybe does not have a .get() method.
Instead, it has an orElseThrowUnchecked() method which is deliberately clear about the fact that it may throw an unchecked exception if the item is missing so that a user of this API can make an informed decision about how to handle the case where the item is missing.

  • Method Details

    • ofNullable

      static <T> Maybe<@Nullable T> ofNullable(@NonNull Class<T> type, @Nullable T item)
      Use this factory method to create a new Maybe instance whose item may or may not be null.

      Example: 

      
      Maybe.ofNullable(String.class, null);
      Note that it is required to supply a Class to ensure that this wrapper can return a valid type when type() is called.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the wrapped item.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the item wrapped by the wrapper. This is used to check if the item is of the correct type.
      item - The initial item of the wrapper. This may be null.
      Returns:
      A new Maybe instance.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the type is null.

    • ofNull

      static <T> Maybe<@Nullable T> ofNull(Class<T> type)
      A more concise version of ofNullable(Class, Object) which is equivalent to Maybe.ofNullable(type, null).
      The Maybe instance returned by this factory method will always be empty, but still know which type it represents.
      So it is required to supply a Class to ensure that the wrapper can return a valid type when type() is called.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the wrapped item.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the item wrapped by the monad.
      Returns:
      A new Maybe instance.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the supplied type is null.

    • of

      static <T> Maybe<T> of(@NonNull T item)
      This factory method creates and returns a Maybe representing the supplied non-null item similar to Optional.of(Object).
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the item held by the Maybe!
      Parameters:
      item - The initial item of the wrapper which must not be null.
      Returns:
      A new Maybe instance wrapping the given item.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the supplied item is null. Use ofNullable(Class, Object) if the item may be null.

    • of

      static <T> Maybe<T> of(Maybe<T> toBeCopied)
      A factory method for creating a new Maybe instance which is effectively an immutable copy of the given Maybe. The provided Maybe must not contain a null item.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the item held by the Maybe!
      Parameters:
      toBeCopied - The Maybe to be copied.
      Returns:
      A new Maybe instance.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the supplied Maybe is null.
      MissingItemRuntimeException - If the item of the supplied Maybe is null.

    • ofNullable

      static <T extends @Nullable Object> Maybe<@Nullable T> ofNullable(Maybe<T> toBeCopied)
      A factory method for creating a new Maybe instance which is effectively an immutable copy of the given Maybe. The provided Maybe may contain a null item.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the item held by the Maybe!
      Parameters:
      toBeCopied - The Maybe to be copied.
      Returns:
      A new Maybe instance.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the supplied Maybe is null. Does not throw however, if the item of the supplied Maybe is null.

    • type

      Class<T> type()
      This returns the type of the item wrapped by this Maybe which can be accessed by calling the orElseThrow() method.
      Returns:
      The type of the item wrapped by the Maybe.

    • toOptional

      default Optional<T> toOptional()
      Use this to turn this to an Optional which can be used to interact with the item wrapped by this Maybe in a more functional way.
      Returns:
      An Optional wrapping the item wrapped by this Maybe.

    • orElseNullable

      default @Nullable T orElseNullable(@Nullable T other)
      If an item is present, returns the item, otherwise returns other.
      Parameters:
      other - the item to be returned, if no item is present. May be null.
      Returns:
      the item, if present, otherwise other

    • orElse

      default @NonNull T orElse(@NonNull T other)
      If an item is present, returns the item, otherwise returns other, but neve null.
      If the supplied alternative is null, then this method will throw a NullPointerException.
      Parameters:
      other - the item to be returned, if no item is present. May never be null.
      Returns:
      the item, if present, otherwise other
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the supplied alternative is null.

    • orElseGet

      default T orElseGet(@NonNull Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
      If an item is present, returns the item, otherwise returns the result produced by the supplying function.
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplying function that produces an item to be returned
      Returns:
      the item, if present, otherwise the result produced by the supplying function
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if no item is present and the supplying function is null

    • orElseNull

      @Nullable T orElseNull()
      If an item is present, returns the item, otherwise returns null.
      Returns:
      the item, if present, otherwise null

    • orElseThrowUnchecked

      default @NonNull T orElseThrowUnchecked()
      If an item is present, returns the item, otherwise throws an unchecked MissingItemRuntimeException. You may use this if you are fine with the control flow of your application being interacted with by an unchecked exception.
      It is recommended to use orElseThrow() instead, which throws a checked MissingItemException that you must handle explicitly in your code.
      If you can resort to an alternative value when in case the item of this Maybe is missing, use orElse(Object) or orElseGet(Supplier) instead of the throw methods.
      Returns:
      the non-null item described by this Maybe
      Throws:
      MissingItemRuntimeException - if no item is present

    • orElseThrow

      default @NonNull T orElseThrow() throws MissingItemException
      If an item is present, returns the item, otherwise throws a checked MissingItemException, requiring you to handle it explicitly in your code. If you want to access the item without handling an exception, use orElseThrowUnchecked(), which throws the unchecked MissingItemRuntimeException, a subclass of RuntimeException.
      The preferred way to unpack the item of this Maybe is to use this method, as it makes your intention clear and forces you to handle the case where the item is missing.
      If you can resort to an alternative value when the item is missing, use orElse(Object) or orElseGet(Supplier) instead any of the throw methods.
      Returns:
      the non-null item described by this Maybe
      Throws:
      MissingItemException - if no item is present

    • itemAsString

      default String itemAsString()
      This method simply returns a String representation of the wrapped item which would otherwise be accessed via the orElseThrow() method. Calling it should not have any side effects.
      The string conversion is based on the String.valueOf(Object) method, and if the item is null, the string "null" will be returned.
      Returns:
      The String representation of the item wrapped by an implementation of this interface.

    • typeAsString

      default String typeAsString()
      This method returns a String representation of the type of the wrapped item. Calling it should not have any side effects.
      Returns:
      A simple String representation of the type of the item wrapped by an implementation of this interface.

    • is

      default boolean is(@Nullable T otherItem)
      This method checks if the provided item is equal to the item wrapped by this Maybe. This is functionally equivalent to calling Val.equals(otherItem, orElseNull()). Note that this differs from Objects.equals(Object, Object) in that it also treats the equality of arrays, like int[], String[], etc., in terms of their contents, not their references.
      So the following code will return true: 
      
    int[] arr1 = {1, 2, 3};
    int[] arr2 = {1, 2, 3};
    boolean equal = Maybe.of(arr1).is(arr2);
    System.out.println( equal ); // == true
      Parameters:
      otherItem - The other item of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the provided item is equal to the wrapped item.

    • is

      default boolean is(@NonNull Maybe<@Nullable T> other)
      This method check if the item by the provided wrapper is equal to the item wrapped by this Maybe instance.
      Parameters:
      other - The other wrapper of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the item of the supplied wrapper is equal to the wrapped item.

    • isNot

      default boolean isNot(@Nullable T otherItem)
      This method check if the provided item is not equal to the item wrapped by this Maybe instance. This is the opposite of is(Object) which returns true if the items are equal.
      Parameters:
      otherItem - The other item of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the provided item is not equal to the wrapped item.

    • isNot

      default boolean isNot(@NonNull Maybe<@Nullable T> other)
      This method check if the item of the provided wrapper is not equal to the item wrapped by this Maybe wrapper instance. This is the opposite of is(Maybe) which returns true if the items are equal.
      Parameters:
      other - The other wrapper of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the item of the supplied wrapper is not equal to the wrapped item.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the supplied Maybe is null.

    • isOneOf

      default boolean isOneOf(@Nullable T first, @Nullable T second, @Nullable T... otherValues)
      This method checks if at least one of the provided items is equal to the item wrapped by this Maybe instance.
      Parameters:
      first - The first item of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      second - The second item of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      otherValues - The other items of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the provided item is equal to the wrapped item.

    • isOneOf

      default boolean isOneOf(@NonNull Maybe<@Nullable T> first, @NonNull Maybe<@Nullable T> second, @NonNull Maybe<@Nullable T>... otherValues)
      This checks if at least one of the items of the provided properties is equal to the item wrapped by this Maybe instance.
      Parameters:
      first - The first wrapper of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      second - The second wrapper of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      otherValues - The other properties of the same type as is wrapped by this.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the item of the supplied wrapper is equal to the wrapped item.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the supplied arguments is null.

    • isPresent

      default boolean isPresent()
      If an item is present, returns true, otherwise false.
      Returns:
      true if an item is present, otherwise false

    • isEmpty

      default boolean isEmpty()
      If an item is not present, returns true, otherwise false.
      Returns:
      true if an item is not present, otherwise false

    • ifPresent

      default void ifPresent(@NonNull Consumer<T> action)
      If an item is present, performs the given action with the item, otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be performed, if an item is present
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if item is present and the given Consumer action is null

    • ifPresentOrElse

      default void ifPresentOrElse(@NonNull Consumer<? super T> action, @NonNull Runnable emptyAction)
      If an item is present, performs the given action with the item, otherwise performs the given empty-based action.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be performed if an item is present
      emptyAction - the empty-based action to be performed, if no item is present in this Maybe
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if an item is present and the given action is null, or no item is present and the given empty-based action is null.

    • or

      default Maybe<T> or(@NonNull Supplier<? extends Maybe<? extends T>> supplier)
      If an item is present, returns a Maybe describing the item, otherwise returns a Maybe produced by the supplying function.
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplying function that produces a Maybe to be returned
      Returns:
      returns a Maybe describing the item of this Maybe, if an item is present, otherwise a Maybe produced by the supplying function.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the supplying function is null or produces a null result

    • map

      Maybe<T> map(@NonNull Function<T,T> mapper)
      If the item is present, applies the provided mapping function to it, and returns it wrapped in a new Maybe instance.
      If the item is not present, then an empty Maybe instance is returned.

      But note that the resulting Maybe is in no way a live view of this Maybe and will not be updated when this instance changes. This is because a Maybe is an immutable monadic type.
      It is functionally very similar to the Optional.map(Function) method.

      This is essentially the same as Optional.map(Function) but based on Maybe as the wrapper instead of Optional.

      Parameters:
      mapper - the mapping function to apply to an item, if present
      Returns:
      A new Maybe either empty (containing null) or containing the result of applying the mapping function to the item wrapped by this Maybe.

    • mapTo

      <U> Maybe<U> mapTo(@NonNull Class<U> type, @NonNull Function<T,U> mapper)
      If the item is present, applies the provided mapping function to it, and returns it wrapped in a new Maybe instance.
      If the item is not present, then an empty Maybe instance is returned.

      But note that the resulting Maybe is in no way a live view of this Maybe and will not be updated when this instance changes. This is because a Maybe is an immutable monadic type.
      It is functionally similar to the Optional.map(Function) method.

      Type Parameters:
      U - The type of the item returned from the mapping function
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the item returned from the mapping function
      mapper - the mapping function to apply to an item, if present
      Returns:
      A new maybe either empty (containing null) or containing the result of applying the mapping function to the item of this maybe.
